label: Get User Input
tooltip: Capture user input with options like text, numbers, URLs, and dropdowns, to collect dynamic responses.

inputs.name: input_type
inputs.label: Input Type
inputs.hint: Choose the type of input you want to capture from the user, such as text, number, or dropdown selection. For example, select 'Text' for open-ended input, 'URL' for web links, or 'Yes/No' for binary responses.

inputs.name: input_description
inputs.label: Input Label
inputs.hint: Write a clear prompt to guide users on what information is required. For example, 'Please enter your email address' or 'Select your preferred contact method.'

inputs.name: default_value
inputs.label: Default Value
inputs.hint: Provide a default response that appears automatically, guiding users or simplifying input. For example, 'example@domain.com' for an email field.

inputs.name: required
inputs.label: Required?
inputs.hint: Mark this checkbox if this input is mandatory. For example, enable it if a response is essential to proceed in the workflow.

inputs.name: input_name
inputs.label: Output Variable Name
inputs.hint: Assign a unique variable name for the input value, such as 'user_email' or 'preferred_contact', which you can reference later in the workflow. No spaces or special characters, spaces, or dashes are allowed.

validation.message: Variable names must start with a letter and can only contain letters, numbers, and underscores (_).

label: Generate Content
tooltip: Generate text based on your input prompts.

inputs.name: llm_engine
inputs.label: LLM Engine
inputs.hint: Choose the language model to use, such as 'GPT-4o' for detailed responses or 'Claude Opus' for creative writing.

none.label: Auto Optimized
none.description: Automatically selects the best model for your task

OpenAI.label: GPT-5
OpenAI.description: Smartest model for coding, reasoning, and agentic tasks across domains

OpenAI.description: A faster, more cost-efficient version of GPT-5, great for well-defined tasks and precise prompts

OpenAI.description: Our fastest, cheapest version of GPT-5, great for summarization and classification tasks

Perplexity (with search access).label: Perplexity
Perplexity (with search access).description: Ideal for tasks requiring high creativity and diverse outputs while using live Internet Search

Perplexity (with search access).description: Deep research model that analyzes hundreds of sources, delivering expert-level insights in minutes

DeepSeek.description: Optimized for tasks requiring high accuracy and detail

inputs.name: instructions
inputs.label: Instructions
inputs.hint: Enter detailed instructions for the language model, such as 'Write a summary of the document' or 'Create an engaging email subject line.'

inputs.name: knowledge_bases
inputs.label: Select Attachment(s) for LLM Assistant (uploaded to Knowledge Base)

inputs.name: output_variable_name
inputs.label: Output Variable Name
inputs.hint: Assign a variable name to store the generated text, like 'llm_output' or 'ai_generated_text'.

validation.message: Variable names must start with a letter and can only contain letters, numbers, and underscores (_).

label: Show User Output
tooltip: Display results as HTML, JSON, or tables.

inputs.name: heading
inputs.label: Heading
inputs.hint: Provide a heading for the output display, such as 'User Results' or 'Analysis Summary'.

inputs.name: output_formatted
inputs.label: Output Formatted
inputs.hint:
Enter the formatted output, such as '

Results

Details go here

' for HTML or 'key: value' for JSON-like displays.

inputs.name: format
inputs.label: Format
inputs.hint: Select the format for output display, such as 'HTML', 'JSON', 'Table', or 'Markdown'.
